steps.name: Input Files
steps.description:
Manage the PSG files you want to generate the report.

The PSG file and the accessory file must be in the same folder. 

Add your files (.edf, .eeg or .sts)

- .edf : the .tsv file is mandatory

- .eeg format : the NATUS subject folder is mandatory

- .sts format : the .sig file is mandatory

steps.name: Events Report
steps.description:
Define all the events reports you want to generate.

Begin by selecting a recording (left window : 'filename'), then select an event (at the group or name level).

In the right window via the scrolling menu, select your Event Report.

'Add' it or 'Add to all files'.

Look for possible missing events.

steps.name: Temporal Links
steps.description:
Define all the Temporal links reports you want to generate.

Begin by selecting a recording (left window : 'filename'), then check all the temporal links reports to generate.

Clilck on 'Apply to all files' or check individually each temporal links report for each recording. 

Look for possible missing events when the 'Apply to all files' is performed.

steps.name: Generate Reports
steps.description:
Choose where to save the reports. 

Look at the list of reports to generate.

Go back and fix the list if you see errors.

list.name: Hours and Cycles
list.description: Define the maximum number of hours and cycles to report.

alias.tooltip: List of aliases separated by a semicolon(;) character

file_selection_only.tooltip: Set it to 1 if you only need to select a file and not its montages and channels.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.value:
{'defined_option': 'Aeschbach 1993', 'Include_SOREMP': '1', 'Include_last_incompl': '1', 'Include_all_incompl': '1', 'dur_ends_REMP': '15', 'NREM_min_len_first': '15', 'NREM_min_len_mid_last': '15', 'NREM_min_len_val_last': '5', 'REM_min_len_first': '0.5', 'REM_min_len_mid': '5', 'REM_min_len_last': '0.5', 'mv_end_REMP': '1', 'sleep_stages': 'N2, N3, N4, R', 'details': '

Adjust options based on [1].

\xa0

NREM-REMS cycles were defined [...] by the succession of a NREMS episode of at least 15 min duration and a REMS episode of at least 5 min duration. No minimal duration of the REMS episode was required for the completion of the first and last cycle. NREMS episodes were defined as the time interval between the first occurrence of stage 2 and the first occurrence of REMS within a cycle. Consequently REMS episodes were defined as the time intervals between two consecutive NREMS episodes or the time interval between the last NREMS episode and the final awakening. Thus occasional stage 1 epochs between REMS and stage 2 were included in the REMS episode. The reasons for selecting this criterion were the similarity of the EEG in REMS and stage 1, the better delimitation of cycle onset by using stage 2 instead of stage 1, and the fact that the initiation of cycle 1 with stage 2 corresponds to a frequently used criterion of sleep onset.

\xa0

[1] Aeschbach D, Borbely AA. All-night dynamics of the human sleep EEG. J Sleep Res. 1993 Jun; 2(2):70-81. https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1365-2869.1993.tb00065.x

'}
